Author: hongvann_kh
Content: In reforming Indonesia‚Äôs financial system, we must ask ourselves: How can we create a system that not only serves the wealthy and urban population but truly reaches the rural and marginalized communities? What steps are necessary to balance rapid technological innovation, like fintech and digital banking, with strong regulation and consumer protection? How can financial education be made accessible so that every citizen is empowered to make informed decisions? And importantly, how can transparency and accountability be ensured to rebuild trust in financial institutions? These questions are critical because the answers will shape Indonesia‚Äôs economic future and the well-being of millions.
